intro: Antholyza caryophyllacea, commonly known as the red sandalwood or red sandalwood tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences.
